name: Les Jardins De La Glaciere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite basic, but the hotel has a nice location next to the river and is a good choice if visiting Corte
reviews.title: Basic but decent hotel

reviews.text: Stay away from this hotel, its nothing like the pictures or description on the webpage. Dark and dusty location in the bottom of the valley between the road and the river. Strange smell in the room, and lots of noises from the corridor. Hotel staff locked themselves into the room 7 am without knocking. We found the hotel staff rued. Would rather sleep on the street than in this hotel.
reviews.title: Stay away

reviews.text: We were camping in Saint Florent for several nights as part of our first visit to Corsica. During our stay we decided that a stay in a hotel in the centre of Corsica would be a good way to end before catching the ferry in Bastia for Italy. After checking out a few guidebooks we decided that Jardins de la Glaciere sounded great. I gave them a call and the friendly and efficient member of staff told me that they could not give us a room for both the Saturday and Sunday nights as we had hoped. He did have a room available on the Sunday and this we booked, resigning ourselves to another night on the campsite. Which in reality was no hardship.
reviews.title: Fantastic simple little hotel

reviews.text: We checked into the hotel at 2pm on the Sunday afternoon. Our room wasn't ready so we took the car for a drive up the Restonica Gorge. This is stunning with a very tight and winding road which is not for faint hearted. We eventually pulled up at the side of the road in a parking bay and walked down to the boulder strewn, crystal clear river. We stayed listening to the birds in the trees, the flow of the water over the rocks and the wind of the trees. I also swam in a rock pool in the river, after the time on the coast the fresh, cold water was refreshing in the extreme.
reviews.title: Avoid this!!!

reviews.text: With the advent of a brief rain shower we headed back to the hotel to find that our second floor room was available. The room was large, airy, sparcely furnished with a tiled floor. Perhaps the only downside to this room is that as it is on the corner and the stairs are external, the noise at night from other residents coming in and out of the landing is slightly off putting.
reviews.title: A gem

likes.disliked: — Car park was muddy after lots of rain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in the impressive Gorges de la Restonica, the hotel is an excellent choice.
reviews.title: an excellent 2**

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in an old building the hotel has been upgraded to modern and excellent security equipment. Electronic key cards (which is for a 2** in Corsica certainly luxury!) fire proof doors and simple but nice rooms. Nice renovated bathroom.
reviews.title: Good location, great breakfast

reviews.text: The reception and the other staff was very friendly (and I 'm a bit surprised of the comments of another survey about this)
reviews.title: What a disaster!

likes.disliked: — The shameful way that we were treated

reviews.title: Pleasant rural retreat
reviews.text: Breakfast is best we had in Corsica. Simply very good and lot of choice to "french norms".

aka: Les Jardins De La Glaciere Corte, Corsica, France
